results.title: The High arctic biome
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Describes the constant struggle of plants and animals for survival in the harsh environment of the high arctic biome. Photographed on the arctic coastal lands of Canada. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh O’Connor, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Riddles of Sand and Ice
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 5 examines glacial ice, its movement over thousands of years and what we can learn from it. The massive changes that the planet has endured are now being compounded by the effects of humans on the Earth’s surface. The natural cycle of the Earth’s orbit suggests that long-term, the planet is getting colder, yet it is showing signs of warming due to the increased levels of man-made gases in the atmosphere.

results.title: Community
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Defines the ecological community as a complex network of interrelationships among a group of plants and animals adapted to the same general physical conditions, food chains and food webs.

results.title: Life from the sea
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The Earth’s oceans cover two thirds of the planet’s surface and have been crucial in determining the course of the Earth’s development. The creation of the seas was a turning point, the evolutionary crossroads that forever separated the Earth from the other planets in the solar system.

results.title: The Hotel New Hampshire
results.creator_credit: Tony Richardson, Neil Hartley and Woodfall Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is a fascinating, largely successful adaptation of John Irving’s 1981 novel of the same name. The tale concerns an eccentric New England family that, spurred on by an ever-searching father, establishes a new hotel in locale after locale which mutates in the process. It is a bizarre and whimsical tale starring Rob Lowe and Jodie Foster in the role of brother and sister and Natassja Kinski as a girl so insecure that she hides most of the time inside an enormous bear suit.

results.title: Population ecology
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Shows how environmental conditions such as natural enemies and food factors can help increase or reduce births and deaths. Discusses how humans have created the birth surplus over death called the population explosion. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What is ecology?
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Introduces the study of ecology by illustrating the wide variety of interrelationships between plants, animals and their environment. Introduces the major biomes of the world.

results.title: The Temperate deciduous forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the complex network of plant and animal relationships that make up the temperate deciduous forest community. Shows the adaptations of animals and deciduous plants to seasonal changes.

results.title: The Horse in the gray flannel suit
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Winston Hibler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An advertising executive under pressure to come up with a winning campaign uses, for inspiration, his daughter’s love of horses. This children’s film, centred on horses and equestrian pursuits, is a family-oriented comedy that stars Dean Jones, Fred Bolton, Diane Baker, Lloyd Bochner, Fred Clark and Ellen Janov.
